page.title: 18Somner Billington (Social)
page.content: Kemsey Manor was the centre of many happy occasions and Somner treated everyone with great courtesy. To quote the Rev. Foster's funeral address, "The love which radiated first from Adbaston Hall and latterly from Kemsey Manor, has caught us all up and left us the better for its effect. You have only to think for example of the joyous times at Mother's Union parties, or the over 60's playing croquet on the lawn at Kemsey, to know what I mean. He looked to the future, and the younger generation had no more ardent advocate than he was." He was a humble man. "We shall not see his like again."
